Laporan Meme Anies Jadi Joker, Polisi Bakal Panggil Ade Armando
02 Nov 2019, 04:29 by Adam Prireza, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Kepolisian Daerah Metropolitan Jakarta Raya telah menerima laporan anggota Dewan Perwakilan Daerah (DPD) RI, Fahira Idris, terhadap dosen Universitas Indonesia Ade Armando.
Ade Armando dilaporkan lantaran mengunggah meme berisi wajah Gubernur Anies Baswedan dengan wajah yang didandani ala tokoh fiksi Joker.
Argo mengatakan kalau polisi saat ini tengah melakukan penyelidikan. Mereka berencana memanggil sejumlah orang, termasuk Ade Armando, untuk diklarifikasi terkait laporan tersebut.
Namun, Argo belum merincikan kapan pihak-pihak terkait akan dipanggil. “Masih dalam penyelidikan untuk diklarifikasi dengan pelapor dan saksi-saksi,” ucap Argo saat dikonfirmasi wartawan, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Fahira Idris melaporkan Ade ke polisi pada Jumat malam, 1 November 2019. Ia menduga Ade melanggar Pasal 32 Ayat 1 juncto 48 ayat 1 Undang-Undang Nomor 19 Tahun 2016 tentang Informasi dan Transaksi Elektronik (ITE) dalam unggahannya.
Menurut Fahira, foto Anies Baswedan yang diunggah oleh Ade Armando merupakan dokumen milik Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta atau milik publik yang diubah menjadi seperti Joker. Dalam foto itu, Ade menuliskan kalimat 'Gubernur Jahat Berawal dari Menteri yang Dipecat'.
Ade Armando mengakui kalau dirinya memang secara sadar mengunggah gambar tersebut. Ia mengatakan kalau meme itu merupakan bentuk kecaman terhadap Anies ihwal kejanggalan rencana anggaran DKI Jakarta, seperti pengadaan lem Aibon dan pulpen senilai puluhan hingga ratusan miliar rupiah. “Berbagai kecaman dan kritik terhadapnya dilakukan juga melalui berbagai cara. Saya termasuk di antara kalangan yang mengecam Anies,” tutur Ade.
Ade pun mempermasalahkan laporan tersebut. Menurut dia, kalau ada yang hendak melaporkan dirinya ke polisi seharusnya adalah Anies sendiri, bukan Fahira. “Memang dia (Fahira) apanya Anies?” ucap Ade Aarmando.

Meme Anies Report Become Joker, Police Will Call Ade Armando
02 Nov 2019, 04:29 by Adam Prireza, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Greater Jakarta Metropolitan Regional Police have received reports from members of the Indonesian Regional Representative Council (DPD), Fahira Idris, against a lecturer at the University of Indonesia Ade Armando.
Ade Armando was reported for uploading a meme containing the face of Governor Anies Baswedan with a face dressed up in the style of a fictional Joker character.
Argo said that the police are currently investigating. They plan to summon a number of people, including Ade Armando, to clarify the report.
However, Argo has not specified when the relevant parties will be called. "It is still under investigation to be clarified with reporters and witnesses," Argo said when confirmed by reporters, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Fahira Idris reported Ade to the police on Friday night, November 1, 2019. He suspected that Ade violated Article 32 Paragraph 1 juncto 48 paragraph 1 of Law Number 19 Year 2016 concerning Information and Electronic Transactions (ITE) in his upload.
According to Fahira, Anies Baswedan's photo uploaded by Ade Armando was a document owned by the Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta or publicly-owned, which was changed to be like a Joker. In the photo, Ade wrote the phrase 'Evil Governor Starting with the Fired Minister'.
Ade Armando admitted that he did consciously upload the picture. He said that the meme was a form of criticism of Anies regarding the irregularities in the DKI Jakarta budget plan, such as the procurement of Aibon glue and pens worth tens to hundreds of billions of rupiah. "Various criticisms and criticisms against him also carried out through various ways. I am among those who criticize Anies, "said Ade.
Ade also questioned the report. According to him, if anyone wants to report himself to the police it should be Anies himself, not Fahira. "What is he (Fahira), Anies?" Said Ade Aarmando.
